fullplot: "Patton" tells the tale of General George S. Patton, famous tank commander of World War II. The film begins with Patton's career in North Africa and progresses through the invasion of Europe and the fall of the Third Reich. Side plots also speak of Patton's numerous faults such his temper and tendency toward insubordination, faults that would prevent him from becoming the lead American general in the Normandy Invasion as well as to his being relieved as Occupation Commander of Germany.
plot: The World War II phase of the career of the controversial American general, George S. Patton.
title: Patton

tomatoes.consensus: George C. Scott's sympathetic, unflinching portrayal of the titular general in this sprawling epic is as definitive as any performance in the history of American biopics.

writers: Francis Ford Coppola (screen story and screenplay)
Edmund H. North (screen story and screenplay)
Ladislas Farago (based on factual material from Patton: Ordeal and Triumph)
Omar N. Bradley (based on factual material from: A Soldier's Story)
